attributes.action: Change the £100k threshold eligibility for childcare support in the UK
attributes.additional_details: Living in a household where both parents work to provide income it seems unfair that we are penalised for this.  We are putting money into the economy by working yet miss out on 30 hours free childcare.  The cost of living makes it hard to afford childcare and therefore our children miss out on this benefit.
attributes.background: Households who earn over £100k are not eligible for 30 hours childcare.  The cost of living makes it very hard for us to afford childcare and we are not given the same privileges as others regardless of the fact that pay more tax

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/636643

If you would like the £100,000 income threshold for free childcare to be abolished entirely, we could accept a petition requesting this.
